description: Sum of composite numbers between prime p and nextprime(p) is a repdigit.
formula: Numbers A000040(n) for n > 1 such that A001043(n)*(A001223(n)-1)/2 is in A010785. - _Chai Wah Wu_, Aug 12 2014
example: a(5) is ok since between 259259257 and nextprime 259259261 we get the sum 259259258 + 259259259 + 259259260 which yield repdigit 777777777.
mathematica: repQ[n_]:=Count[DigitCount[n],0]==9; Select[Prime[Range[2,14500000]], repQ[Total[Range[#+1,NextPrime[#]-1]]]&] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Jan 29 2011 *)
prog: (Python)from sympy import primeA054268 = [prime(n) for n in xrange(2,10**5) if len(set(str(int((prime(n+1)-prime(n)-1)*(prime(n+1)+prime(n))/2)))) == 1]# _Chai Wah Wu_, Aug 12 2014
author: _Patrick De Geest_, Apr 15 2000
